intro: Syngonanthus tenuis, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small white or pale green flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its berries are typically red or yellow and serve as a food source for various birds and animals. Syngonanthus tenuis is native to parts of South America and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
